newsitem.title: THAILAND: Two groups submit BBC bank revival plans.
newsitem.headline: Two groups submit BBC bank revival plans.

text.p: Ailing Bangkok Bank of Commerce Plc, administered by a government-appointed panel since May, said it had received two proposals to revive the company.
A BBC official said two Thai investor groups had submitted plans to take over the bank before a Tuesday morning deadline.

Nithipat Capital Plc has said it would apply for a right to rehabilitate BBC in return for its banking licence. SITCA Investment and Securities Plc leads a separate group seeking to run the medium size Thai bank.
BBC has been suspended since May when the central bank said it was saddled with over 70 billion baht ($2.75 billion) of risky and non-performing loans.
The government is expected to take about 10 days in its initial review of rehabilitation proposals by private groups.
BBC required financial rescue earlier this year after disclosure of its loan problems by opposition politicians in parliament triggered a heavy public run on its deposits.
